content.text:
# Your Job

Scan https://github.com/zeroclaw-labs/zeroclaw, https://github.com/openclaw/openclaw, and https://github.com/stephengpope/thepopebot for new tools, skills, and architectures. Pick the best new idea and actually WRITE the code to implement it as a new PopeBot skill in your sandbox (.pi/skills/). Write and execute a test to prove it works. Use the send_email tool to email winsorllc@yahoo.com a progress report detailing what you built, how you implemented it, your test results, and code samples so the user can review it at 8 AM.

content.thinking:
This is a comprehensive task. Let me break it down:

1. Scan three GitHub repositories for new tools, skills, and architectures
2. Pick the best new idea
3. Implement it as a new PopeBot skill in .pi/skills/
4. Write and execute a test
5. Email a progress report to winsorllc@yahoo.com

Let me start by exploring the repositories. I'll need to use browser-tools or bash with git to examine these repos.

Let me first check what's already in the current .pi/skills/ directory to understand the structure, then clone/explore the three repositories.

content.text: I'll systematically scan the three repositories, identify the best new idea, implement it as a skill, test it, and email you a progress report. Let me start by exploring the current environment and then examining each repository.

arguments.command: ls -la pi-skills/ 2>/dev/null || echo "pi-skills directory not found"
